solution_line_template: She wants to read {first_book_words}+{second_book_words}+{third_book_words}=<<{first_book_words}+{second_book_words}+{third_book_words}={total_words}>>{total_words} pages total.
She needs to spend {total_words}/{reading_speed_words_per_hour} = <<{total_words}/{reading_speed_words_per_hour}={total_hours_reading}>>{total_hours_reading} hours reading in the next three weeks.
In minutes, she will need to spend {total_hours_reading}*{minutes_per_hour} = <<{total_hours_reading}*{minutes_per_hour}={total_minutes_reading}>>{total_minutes_reading} minutes.
Thus, she should spend {total_minutes_reading} minutes/{total_days} days = <<{total_minutes_reading}/{total_days}={minutes_per_day_average}>>{minutes_per_day_average} minutes per day reading.
